quote.author: Aerosmith
quote.cite: Life's a journey, not a destination.

quote.author: Albert Einstein
quote.cite: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.

quote.author: Allen Ng
quote.cite: If you ask a stupid question, you'll get an answer, stupid.
I hear the collapse of our civilization in the sounds heard at the grocery store, not in the screams of children, but in the silence of adults.

quote.author: American Indian Proverb
quote.cite: Listen or thy tongue will keep thee deaf.

quote.author: Anne McCaffrey
quote.cite: [They] never discovered and eventually forgot to ask.

quote.author: Aristotle
quote.cite: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence then, is not an act, but a habit.

quote.author: Astragarl Hornwood
quote.cite: Dragons? Splendid things lad--so long as you only look at them in tapestries, or the masks worn at revels, or from about three realms off...

quote.author: Bob Marley
quote.cite: No woman, No cry.

quote.author: Chad Mitchell
quote.cite: Hey! These things--they happen sometimes.

quote.author: Charlie Parker
quote.cite: Music is your own experience, your thoughts, your wisdom. If you don't live it, it won't come out of your horn.

quote.author: Chinese Proverb
quote.cite: Teachers open the door, but you must enter by yourself.

quote.author: David Hockney
quote.cite: Art has to move you and design does not, unless it's a good design for a bus.

quote.author: George Bernard Shaw
quote.cite: Liberty means responsibility. That is why most men dread it.

quote.author: Georges Bidault
quote.cite: The weak have one weapon: the errors of those who they think are strong.

quote.author: Hebrews 9:27a
quote.cite: It is appointed once for a man to die...

quote.author: James Branch Cabell
quote.cite: Mundus Vult Decipi (The world wants to be deceived.)

quote.author: John Stallworthy
quote.cite: They stand most straight who learn to walk beneath a weight.

quote.author: Johnathan Swift
quote.cite: When a true genius appears in the world, you may know him by this sign, that the dunces are all in confederacy against him.

quote.author: Juvenal
quote.cite: If you've run out of luck, it doesn't matter how long your penis is.

quote.author: Louie Armstrong when asked "What is jazz?":
quote.cite: If you have to ask, you'll never know.

quote.author: Al Pacino as Lowell Bergman
quote.cite: Ordinary people under extraordinary stress, Mike. What'd the hell you expect? Grace and consistency?

quote.author: Mark Twain
quote.cite: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.

quote.author: R.A. Salvatore
quote.cite: If a person needs proof of a god's existence, then the very notion of spirituality is diminished into sensuality and we have reduced what is holy into what is logical.
I need no fantasies to belittle the great treasures that I already possess.

quote.author: Rodger Hanson
quote.cite: Right Sailor, Right Place, Wrong Software

quote.author: The Eagles
quote.cite: Somtimes to keep it together you gotta leave it alone.

quote.author: The Tyranny of the Diploma--Forbes Magazine
quote.cite: Time was when a high school diploma was pretty good proof that the holder had received a basic education. No more. Too many high schools certify kids who can barely read or reckon, with the result that employers today want to see a college diploma as evidence of basic literacy.

quote.author: unknown
quote.cite: If you would ever like to go into a cave, I will take you. If you are curious about a dungeon, I'll find you a book on the subject.
The world is so fast that there are days when the person who says it can't be done is interrupted by the person who is doing it.
"I think not!" retorted Descartes and promptly disappeared.
Light travels faster than sound, that's why some people seem bright until they talk.
Habit is the ballast that chains a dog to his vomit.

quote.author: Van Ledbetter
quote.cite: There's a lot of times when you can't save money and save souls at the same time.

quote.author: Yogi Berra
quote.cite: If you don't know where you're going, you'll end up somewhere else.

quote.author: Dave Butler
quote.cite: Silly is a state of Mind; Stupid is a way of Life.

quote.author: Ian Lawuf
quote.cite: I feel like Joe Pelton playing Go Fish!
My name is Ian Lawuf and I Am No Longer Afiliated With U F*@&s

quote.author: Scott Adams
quote.cite: If there are no stupid questions, then what kind of questions do stupid people ask? Do they get smart just in time to ask questions?
